comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Lincoln Steffens was addressing a workers' / IWW / anarchist / socialist / rally in Union Square, New York City, on April 11, 1914. The structure from which he is speaking was more a porch than a balcony. In this photo from May 2, 1914, it is used for a suffragette rally: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5169603438/] Here is William Jennings Bryan, speaking from the same porch, April 30, 1912: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163099709/] A Bain/LOC photo, not yet posted to Flickr, shows the Union Square "cottage" on May 1, 1908, during a May Day Socialist rally: luirig.altervista.org/cpm/albums/bain-27/13401-Socialists... A New York Times story (May 3, 1914) about a woman suffrage rally in Union Square refers to the speakers' platform as "the porch of the cottage" --- query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F50D1EF9355D13...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The anarchist Alexander Berkman addressed another part of the crowd on April 11, 1914:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5126126120/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC: you have misspelled both "Lincoln" and "Steffens" in your title.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Wystan and buckeye616:  Thank you for your correction of the typo in the title and for the additional information on Lincoln Steffens.  We will include some of it in the record for this image when we update.
